memory_items.title: Avoid Blind Searching
memory_items.description: Wasting time by repeatedly searching for items without success.
memory_items.content: The agent repeatedly tried to take soapbar 4 and soapbar 3 from different locations without success. This led to unnecessary steps and wasted time. To prevent this, the agent should first confirm the availability of the required items before attempting to take them. For example, after picking up soapbar 1, the agent should directly proceed to the garbagecan instead of searching again.

memory_items.title: Check Container Status First
memory_items.description: Assuming containers are empty when they actually contain other items.
memory_items.content: The agent assumed that soapbar 4 was available on the countertop and sinkbasin but did not check the actual contents. This led to repeated unsuccessful attempts. Before taking any item, the agent should verify its presence in the container to avoid redundant searches and failed actions.

memory_items.title: Systematic Object Search
memory_items.description: Use when needing to find specific items within a cluttered environment.
memory_items.content: Start by examining the most likely locations where the object might be found. In this case, checking the fridge first was effective because it was mentioned as a potential place for storing food items like lettuce.

memory_items.title: Efficient Cooling Method
memory_items.description: Apply when the task involves cooling an item and immediate access to a refrigerator is available.
memory_items.content: Utilize the nearest refrigerator to cool the item, as demonstrated by using fridge 1 to cool the lettuce. This minimizes travel time and ensures the item is cooled quickly.

memory_items.title: Direct Transfer to Destination
memory_items.description: Employ when moving an item directly from its cooled state to its final destination without unnecessary intermediate steps.
memory_items.content: After cooling the lettuce in the fridge, immediately transfer it to the countertop to avoid any delays or potential contamination. This direct approach ensures efficiency and maintains the freshness of the lettuce.

memory_items.title: Avoid Blind Searching
memory_items.description: Do not repeatedly search for the same object without checking its status.
memory_items.content: The agent repeatedly tried to take vase 2 from shelf 1, which was already empty after taking vase 1. This led to wasted steps and failure. To prevent this, always check if the desired object is available before attempting to take it again.

memory_items.title: Validate Object Availability
memory_items.description: Ensure the object you intend to take is actually present and accessible.
memory_items.content: The agent failed to validate that vase 2 was still on shelf 1 after taking vase 1. This resulted in repeated unsuccessful attempts. Before taking an object, verify its presence and accessibility to avoid unnecessary steps.

memory_items.title: Plan Actions Efficiently
memory_items.description: Plan your actions to minimize redundant movements and checks.
memory_items.content: The agent made multiple redundant trips to shelf 1, which did not contribute to achieving the task goal. Efficient planning involves minimizing unnecessary movements and ensuring each action directly contributes to the task completion. Plan actions to target specific goals and avoid repetitive checks.
